member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigDrag
member.summary: Configuration class for the Drag gesture.
member.remarks: A drag gesture can be composed of 1 or more fingers.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfig
member.summary: This represents the base class for all gesture configuration.

remarks.para: Gesture configurations cannot be modified after being added to the input system for gesture recognition. Doing so will throw an .
Gesture Recognizers work with normalized coordinates belonging to [0,1]x[0,1/screenRatio] so distances, speeds and margin errors need to be expressed relatively to this coordinates system.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfig.frozen
member.summary: Indicate that the configuration is frozen and cannot be modified anymore by the user.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfig.Freeze
member.summary: Freeze the configuration so that the user cannot modify it anymore.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfig.CreateRecognizer(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a recognizer for the current configuration.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfig.AssociatedGestureType
member.summary: Specify the corresponding to this configuration.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfig.RequiredNumberOfFingers
member.summary: This value represents the required number of simultaneous finger to tap to trigger the gesture. For example: 1 for single finger, and so on...
member.remarks: This value is strictly positive.
member.exception: The given value is not in the allowed range.
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigDrag.#ctor
member.summary: Create a default drag gesture configuration for one finger free dragging.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigDrag.#ctor(SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureShape)
member.summary: Create a default drag gesture configuration for one finger dragging.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigDrag.MinimumDragDistance
member.summary: Specify the minimum translation distance required before that the gesture can be recognized as a Drag.
member.exception: Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.
The provided value was negative.
member.remarks: The user can reduce this value if he needs the drag gesture to be triggered even for very small drags. On the contrary, he can increase this value if he wants to avoid to deals with too small drags.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigDrag.AllowedErrorMargins
member.summary: The (x,y) error margins allowed during directional dragging.
member.exception: Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.
The provided x or y value was not positive.
member.remarks: Those values are used only for directional (vertical or horizontal) dragging. Decrease those values to trigger the gesture only when the dragging is perfectly in the desired direction. Increase those values to allow directional gestures to be more approximative.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigDrag.DragShape
member.summary: The shape (direction) of the drag gesture.
member.exception: Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigFlick
member.summary: Configuration class for the Flick gesture.
member.remarks: A Flick gesture can be composed of 1 or more fingers.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigFlick.#ctor
member.summary: Create a default Flick gesture configuration for one finger free flicking.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigFlick.#ctor(SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureShape)
member.summary: Create a default gesture configuration for one finger flicking.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigFlick.AllowedErrorMargins
member.summary: The (x,y) error margins allowed during directional dragging.
member.exception: Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.
The provided x or y value was not positive.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigFlick.FlickShape
member.summary: The shape of the flick gesture.
member.exception: Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigFlick.MinimumAverageSpeed
member.summary: The minimum average speed of the gesture to be detected as a flick.
member.exception: The value must be positive
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigFlick.MinimumFlickLength
member.summary: The minimum distance that the flick gesture has to cross from its origin to be detected has Flick.
member.exception: Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GamePadState
member.summary: Describes the state of a gamepad.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GamePadState.IsConnected
member.summary: A boolean indicating the connect status of this gamepad. true if connected, otherwise false.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GamePadState.LeftThumb
member.summary: Left thumbstick x-axis/y-axis value. The value is in the range [-1.0f, 1.0f] for both axis.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GamePadState.RightThumb
member.summary: Right thumbstick x-axis/y-axis value. The value is in the range [-1.0f, 1.0f] for both axis.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GamePadState.LeftTrigger
member.summary: The left trigger analog control in the range [0, 1.0f]. See remarks.
member.remarks: Some controllers are not supporting the range of value and may act as a simple button returning only 0 or 1.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GamePadState.RightTrigger
member.summary: The right trigger analog control in the range [0, 1.0f]. See remarks.
member.remarks: Some controllers are not supporting the range of value and may act as a simple button returning only 0 or 1.

member.summary: The current position (in pixels) of the drag event.

member.summary: Event class for the Composite gesture.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.CenterBeginningPosition
member.summary: The position of the center of the composite transformation at the beginning of the gesture (in normalized coordinates [0,1]).
member.remarks: The center of the transformation corresponds to the middle of the 2 fingers.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.CenterCurrentPosition
member.summary: The current position of the center of the composite transformation (in normalized coordinates [0,1]).
member.remarks: The center of the transformation corresponds to the middle of the 2 fingers.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.DeltaRotation
member.summary: The rotation angle (in radian) since the last event of the gesture.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.TotalRotation
member.summary: The rotation angle (in radian) since the beginning of the gesture.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.DeltaScale
member.summary: The difference of scale since the last event of the gesture.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.TotalScale
member.summary: The difference of scale since the beginning of the gesture.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.DeltaTranslation
member.summary: The translation (in pixels) performed since the last event of the gesture.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureEventComposite.TotalTranslation
member.summary: The translation (in pixels) performed since the beginning of the gesture.

member.summary: The number of time the use successively touched the screen.

member.summary: The position (in pixels) of the tap.

member.summary: A gesture recognizer for continuous motions.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureShape.Horizontal
member.summary: Represent a gesture that has its shape along the horizontal axis.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureShape.Vertical
member.summary: Represent a gesture that has its shape along the vertical axis.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureShape.Free
member.summary: Represent a gesture that has a random shape.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureState
member.summary: The different possible states of a gestures.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureType
member.summary: List all the available type of Gestures.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureType.Drag
member.summary: The user touched the screen and then performed a free translation.
member.remarks: Drag is a continuous gesture.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureType.Flick
member.summary: The user touched the screen and then performed a quick swipe.
member.remarks: Flick is a discrete gesture.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureType.LongPress
member.summary: The user touched and maintained a point on the screen.
member.remarks: LongPress is a discrete gesture.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureType.Composite
member.summary: The user touched two points of the screen and performed a composite transformation (translation, rotation, scale).
member.remarks: Rotation is a continuous gesture.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureType.Tap
member.remarks: Tap is a discrete gesture.

member.summary: List of the gestures to recognize.
member.remarks: To detect a new gesture add its configuration to the list. To stop detecting a gesture remove its configuration from the list. To all gestures detection clear the list. Note that once added to the list the s are frozen by the system and cannot be modified anymore.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.IInputManager.MultiTouchEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if simultaneous multiple finger touches are enabled or not. If not enabled only the events of one finger at a time are triggered.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigLongPress.MaximumTranslationDistance
member.summary: The value represents the maximum distance a finger can translate during the longPress action.
member.exception: The value has to be positive.
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.
member.remarks: By increasing this value, the user allows small movements of the fingers during the long press. By decreasing this value, the user forbids any movements during the long press.

member.summary: The time the user has to hold his finger on the screen to trigger the gesture.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigComposite
member.summary: Configuration class for the Composite gesture.

remarks.para: A composite gesture is a transformation which is a composition of a translation, a rotation and a scale. It is performed by using two fingers and performing translation, scale and rotation motions.
A composite gesture can only be composed of 2 fingers. Trying to modify the field will throw an exception.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigComposite.#ctor
member.summary: Create a default Rotation gesture configuration.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigComposite.MinimumScaleValue
member.summary: The scale value above which the gesture is started.
member.exception: The value has to be greater or equal to 1.
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.
member.remarks: The user can increase this value if he has small or no interest in the scale component of the transformation. By doing so, he avoids triggering the Composite Gesture when only small scale changes happen. On the contrary, the user can decrease this value if he wants to be immediately warned about the smallest change in scale.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigComposite.MinimumTranslationDistance
member.summary: The translation distance above which the gesture is started.
member.exception: The value has to be positive.
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.
member.remarks: The user can increase this value if he has small or no interest in the translation component of the transformation. By doing so, he avoids triggering the Composite Gesture when only small translation changes happen. On the contrary, the user can decrease this value if he wants to be immediately warned about the smallest change in translation.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigComposite.MinimumRotationAngle
member.summary: The rotation angle (in radian) above which the gesture is started.
member.exception: The angle has to be strictly positive.
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.
member.remarks: The user can increase this value if he has small or no interest in the rotation component of the transformation. By doing so, he avoids triggering the Composite Gesture when only small rotation changes happen. On the contrary, the user can decrease this value if he wants to be immediately warned about the smallest change in rotation.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigTap
member.summary: Configuration class for the Tap gesture.
member.remarks: A tap gesture can be composed of 1 or more fingers.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigTap.#ctor
member.summary: Create a default Tap gesture configuration for single touch and single finger detection.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigTap.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a default Tap gesture configuration for the given numbers of touches and fingers.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigTap.RequiredNumberOfTaps
member.summary: This value represents the required number of successive user touches to trigger the gesture. For example: 1 for single touch, 2 for double touch, and so on...
member.remarks: This value is strictly positive.
member.exception: The given value is not greater or equal to 1.
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigTap.MaximumTimeBetweenTaps
member.summary: This value represents the maximum interval of time that can separate two touches of a same gesture. By reducing this value, the system will tend to detect multi-touch gesture has several single touch gesture. By increasing this value, the system will tend to regroup distant (in time) single touch gestures into a multi-touch gesture.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigTap.MaximumPressTime
member.summary: This value represents the maximum amount of time that the user can stay touching the screen before taking off its finger.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.GestureConfigTap.MaximumDistanceTaps
member.summary: The value represents the maximum distance that can separate two touches of the same finger during the gesture. By reducing this value, the system will tend to detect multi-touch gesture has several single touch gesture. By increasing this value, the system will tend to regroup distant single touch gestures into a multi-touch gesture.
member.exception: The value has to be positive.
Tried to modify the configuration after it has been frozen by the system.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.Input.VirtualButtonTwoWay
member.summary: Describes a using the sum of a negative and positive button.
member.remarks: This virtual button is for example useful to bind a key to a negative value (key 'left') and another key to a positive value (key 'right') thus simulating an axis button. The result of this virtual Result = PositiveButton.GetValue - NegativeButton.GetValue;
